title: Add uploaded images as public assets and display them on homepage via getAssetUrl

requirements.summary: Add the two uploaded JPGs to frontend public generated assets so they are shipped and served as static files.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/public/assets/generated/IMG_20260208_030749-3.jpg` exists in the repo and is served by the app in production.
`frontend/public/assets/generated/image-1.jpg` exists in the repo and is served by the app in production.
No backend image serving is introduced; both images are referenced as public static assets.

file_operations.description: Add the uploaded image file with the exact filename and casing at `frontend/public/assets/generated/IMG_20260208_030749-3.jpg` so it is included in production builds.
Add the uploaded image file with the exact filename and casing at `frontend/public/assets/generated/image-1.jpg` so it is included in production builds.

requirements.summary: Update homepage to use IMG_20260208_030749-3.jpg as the default couple photo and render image-1.jpg as a secondary visible photo, both loaded via getAssetUrl without absolute-root paths.
acceptanceCriteria: Before any user file selection, the main homepage couple photo renders from `getAssetUrl('assets/generated/IMG_20260208_030749-3.jpg')` and does not trigger the inline default-image load error.
`image-1.jpg` is also displayed on the homepage (e.g., as a secondary smaller image or inset) and is loaded via `getAssetUrl('assets/generated/image-1.jpg')`.
The secondary image placement does not overlap or block the Yes/No buttons at any stage, including after multiple No clicks when the Yes button scales up.
All homepage references to these default assets use `getAssetUrl(...)` (no `src="/assets/..."` absolute-root paths).

file_operations.description: Update the `useClientImagePreview(...)` default to `getAssetUrl('assets/generated/IMG_20260208_030749-3.jpg')` and add a secondary, visibly-rendered `` on the homepage using `getAssetUrl('assets/generated/image-1.jpg')`, positioned in the existing layout so it cannot overlap/block the Yes/No buttons (including during Yes-button scale growth). Ensure no absolute-root asset paths are introduced.
